intro: Afrohybanthus vatsavayae, commonly known as the Vatsavayana hybanthus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Passifloraceae, which includes passionflowers, and is characterized by its showy, colorful flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with woody stems and compound leaves. Its flowers are usually bisexual, with five sepals, five petals, and a distinctive crown of filaments around the reproductive structures. Afrohybanthus vatsavayae is often found in rocky or sandy soils in woodland or shrubland habitats.
